newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Gunmen ambush police in Pakistan town, seven die.
newsitem.headline: Gunmen ambush police in Pakistan town, seven die.

text.p: Gunmen killed six policemen and a civilian in Larkana, home town of Pakistan's ousted prime minister Benazir Bhutto, on Tuesday, police said.
A police spokesman said gunmen in a white car had ambushed a police vehicle at a railway crossing at Ghanti Gate in Larkana in the southern province of Sindh at 8.20 a.m. (0320 GMT).
He said a deputy superintendent of police was among six policemen killed. A civilian also died in the shooting.
"The bodies of the dead have been removed to Larkana Civil Hospital," Maulana Sattar Edhi, head of the private Edhi Welfare Trust, which runs an ambulance service, told Reuters.
The police spokesman in Karachi said he did not know the motive for the shooting. "We are still investigating," he said.

Sindh province gained a reputation for numerous robberies and kidnappings for ransom in the early 1990s, prompting the authorities to launch a military operation to flush out the gangs operating mainly in rural areas.
